name: Explore Bologna on a walking tour (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Bologna is a beautiful medieval city with great history, culture and food. This tour takes you through the incredible history, architecture and culture of this amazing city. Open to children of all ages :) Couples and singles, everyone is welcome. The tour will be: 
- Meeting in Via Indipendenza in front of the statue of Garibaldi on his horse; 
- Historical description of the origin of the city and its location with great medieval stories of antiquity. 
- Visit to the square with a cultural and historical explanation of the surrounding buildings; 
- Marvel at the prestigious market area with food recommendations and Bolognese cooking lessons. 
- Then on the walk to the two towers (Due Torri) and we will briefly delve into the history of the towers. 
- We will briefly visit the 7 churches in Piazza Santo Stefano (Basilica Santo Stefano) and the typical street of the Bologna University campus, Via Zamboni. 
- Back to our original meeting point where I will give you more travel tips for a fantastic lunch or dinner that only a local can tell you in order to enjoy the most authentic Bolognese food. I'll send you a message on Guruwalk to ask for your confirmation the day before. Just make sure you are there :)

name: San Luca Panoramic Tour (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
This tour is for all lovers of nature, sports, art and architecture, all those who want to bring down traditional Bolognese food, known for its large quantities and want to enjoy a wonderful walk with spectacular views.

The tour begins at the Porta Zaragossa where the longest arcade in the world begins, connecting the city of Bologna with the San Luca monastery. As we leave the city behind, we will talk about the secrets and anecdotes that are hidden until we reach the top to appreciate nature and the panoramic view of the Bolognese hills.

name: Free Tour Bologna: Hunting for the Towers! (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Hunting for the Towers!
Did you know that in the Middle Ages Bologna had almost 100 towers? Some almost 100 m high, like the Torre degli Asinelli, others lower and used as fortified houses.
Today we can admire about 23 towers, incorporated into the modern city.
We will go hunting for a dozen of these, and we will explore the historic center with our nose up!
For each stage, we will see 1 or more medieval towers.

Where are we going to go:

  • Piazza del Nettuno
  • Piazza Maggiore
  • Galileo Galilei square
  • Piazza dei Celestini and Catalani tower
  • Galluzzi court and tower
  • Piazza Galvani and Archiginnasio
  • Via Marchesana (mwzzo market)

  • Piazza Santo Stefano

name: Bologna how beautiful you are under the arcades! (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Bologna is defined as the Red, the Learned, the Fat ... but above all, Bologna is the city of arcades.
Since the Middle Ages, these structures, first in wood and then in masonry, have marked the urban evolution of the city.
Present from the 11th century until today, they are a private space but open and public at the same time.
About 45km of arcades only within the city walls and about 60km in total, make Bologna the city with the most arcades in the world.
Bologna is officially the "City of Porticoes" with the nomination of UNESCO World Heritage , which arrived on July 28, 2021, directly from Fuzhou in China. The registration constitutes a new recognition by UNESCO for the city of Bologna which, in 2006, was declared the Creative City of Music .
On this tour, we will walk together to admire the most significant examples of Bolognese portico.
Where are we going to go:

  • Piazza del Nettuno
  • Porticoes of the Palazzo del Podestà
  • Porticoes of the Town Hall
  • Arcades of via Ugo Bassi
  • Arcades of via Galliera
  • Portici via dell'Indipendenza
  • Piazza Maggiore
  • Archiginnasio arcades
  • Take us via Farini
  • Piazza Cavour arcades
  • Arcades of Castiglione and Santo Stefano
  • Piazza Santo Stefano
  • Corte Isolani
  • Two towers
  • Piazza della Mercanzia
  • Middle Market
  • King Enzo square

name: The wonderful squares of Bologna (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Let's discover together the most beautiful and evocative squares in the center of Bologna!
From piazza Maggiore with San Petronio and the Palazzo Comunale, passing through the piazza dell'Archiginnasio where the seat of the ancient University is located.
We will visit Piazza Santo Stefano and admire the complex known as the "seven churches".
Did you know that in the heart of Bologna there are some monumental trees that exceed 45 meters in height?
In Piazza Minghetti, next to the famous Quadrilatero and its typically Italian food shops, there is the large centenary plane tree that embraces us with its branches.
And in Piazza San Giovanni in Monte, a rarity, a church with a Venetian-style facade surrounded by houses in pure Bolognese style.
Our stages:

  • Piazza del Nettuno (departure)
  • King Enzo square
  • Piazza Maggiore
  • Piazza Luigi Galvani or of the Archiginnasio
  • Piazza Cavour
  • Piazza San Domenico

  • Minghetti Square
  • Piazza San Giovanni in Monte
  • Piazza Santo Stefano

name: Bologna and its secrets through food tales - Free Tour (Available in English)
description:
Hello!
My name is Marco,  I'm an Emilia Romagna certified tour leader, an archaeologist, and I'm here to share with you my love for my city: Bologna.
I'm definitely a local: I was born here, as my parents, and I live in a building facing the main square, so basically we will have a walk in my neighbourhood :)

My maximum group is 5 people, so it's gonna be a kind of a "private" tour.

With me, you'll discover the basics information about our major artistic contributions to the world: great foods !

Ok, also a twist of art and monuments, but not too much, I promise.
You'll see something you won't find in books , with an easygoing enthusiasm, because Bologna is this kind of city: not arrogant, quite humble, always friendly.
Besides being an archaeologist, I am also a food maniac with a sommelier degree, so I will be ready to show you all the secrets about Bolognese food.

We will start from Piazza Maggiore, with tales about flying pigs (literally!) And a hidden Michelangelo statue in plain sight. After we will enter (for a second) in the lobby of the Archaeological Museum to discover how ancient is our love for food :)
Nearby we will discover all the little things that made Bologna famous in the world , and we will wander into the tiny streets of the old market.
The Two Towers will be our bridge to go into the university area of the Jewish ghetto with its mardi gras tradition of wine falling from the sky.
We will finish our walk in Piazza Maggiore, whispering through walls where a king tried to escape in a bread basket.
Interesting, isn't it?

As you see the history of Bologna has always been linked to food, so this will be a tour that will stimulate your appetite, for sure.
Ready to go?

name: Sights, Stories & Tastes of Bologna - Free walking tour (Available in English, Italian)
description:
Enjoy the best of both worlds! Experience the Italian way of life first by seeing the most important and beautiful landmarks of Bologna during a pleasant walk through the city's medieval center. Then taste a variety of local culinary specialties at different venues throughout town. Bologna is most famous for its "made for walking" medieval downtown area and its legendary cuisine – frequently referred to as the best and richest tasting by Italians themselves. This tour will be equally divided between seeing the city's most important and significant landmarks (as well as some hidden gems and the many curious stories, anecdotes and legends behind them) and enjoying a variety of local culinary specialties ranging from wines, cheeses, cold cuts to sweets or ice-cream and other finger foods according to the customers' preferences. Highlights: • Experience Piazza Maggiore square - the heart of the city • Visit the sprawling San Petronio cathedral • See the original site of the world's oldest university • Visit the truly one of a kind Seven Churches cluster • Explore the old town's open-air markets and cafes • Taste some of the local food specialties • Everything can be 100% personalized to your tastes Tour Itinerary: • Neptune Fountain Famous bronze statue is one of the symbols of city • Piazza Maggiore square The city's main square and pulsating heart • Basilica di San Petronio cathedral Huge gothic church famous for its "imperfections" and storied history • Voltone del Podesta' passageway Arched passageway which is infamous for being the site of public hangings also features some very unique "acoustic properties". • Archiginnasio Courtyard Visit the first official site of western world's oldest university • Enjoy a walk under the porticoes Bologna features the most extensive stretch of covered walkways in the world – over 40 km worth • PIazza Santo Stefano square and the Seven Churches cluster Santo Stefano square is widely the considered the prettiest square in Bologna. It is also home to the truly one-of-a-kind Sette Chiese or the Seven Churches cluster. • The Two Towers These two leaning towers originally built in the 12th century are the ultimate symbol of the city which was actually filled with dozens of towers during medieval times. • Quadrilatero area markets and cafes Explore the narrow pedestrian streets of the old-town with its open-air food markets and cafes
